abstract: Former Korean Air vice president Cho Hyun-ah, serving one year sentence in South Korea for forcing Korean Air plane to return to gate at Kennedy International Airport because she did not like way she was served nuts by flight attendant, is released from prison after appeals court reduces her sentence.
lead_paragraph: A former Korean Air vice president who had ordered a plane back to its gate in a rage over how she was served macadamia nuts was released from prison after an appeals-court judge reduced her sentence.

headline.main: South Korea: Ex-Executive Is Freed in Ruling on ‘Nut Rage’ Episode
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Ex-Executive Is Freed in Ruling on ‘Nut Rage’ Episode

snippet: A former Korean Air vice president who had ordered a plane back to its gate in a rage over how she was served macadamia nuts was released from prison after an appeals-court judge reduced her sentence.
